title: How to use the functions
text: package provides helper functions conveniently change extract metadata laz files. makes use lidR lasR packages.
code: library(managelidar)

title: How to use the functions
text: Use function plot_extent() plot bounding boxes laz files folder top interactive map (using mapview package).
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package="managelidar") plot_extent(f)

title: How to use the functions
text: Use function get_density() extract approximate pulse density (first/last-return ) laz files. function header lasfiles read density calculated bounding box data file number first-returns. take account parts bounding box missing data, hence density reflect density calculates e.g. lidR. However, much faster read entire file density approximately entire bounding box point data.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jens Wiesehahn. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wiesehahn J (2026). managelidar: Manage Lidar Data Files. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/wiesehahn/managelidar.
code: @Manual{,   title = {managelidar: Manage Lidar Data Files},   author = {Jens Wiesehahn},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/wiesehahn/managelidar}, }

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: goal managelidar facilitate handling management lidar data files (*.las/laz/copc). ’s main purpose convert new incoming data data certain quality standards. , provides functions facilitate quality check incoming ALS data. managelidar builds top R-packages {lidR} {lasR}. designed work number combination folders, LASfiles Virtual Point Clouds (VPC) read little data necessary. functions read metadata VPCs efficiently created lasR background necessary. possible metadata read LASheaders via lidR little slower still pretty fast. functions (e.g. get_summary()) require actual point cloud data read, may take much longer. enhance processing speed functions run parallel (via {mirai}) applied larger collection files.

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: can install development version {managelidar} GitHub : functions depend {lasR} package (version >= 0.14.1) hosted https://r-lidar.r-universe.dev/lasR. available via CRAN manually install advance :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("nwfva-b4/managelidar") # Install lasR in R: install.packages("lasR", repos = c("https://r-lidar.r-universe.dev", "https://cran.r-project.org"))

title: Manage Lidar Data Files
text: Just basic examples package usage.
code: library(managelidar)  # create various valid input paths folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") las_files <- list.files(folder, full.names = T, pattern = "*.laz") las_file <- las_files[1] vpc_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".vpc") lasR::exec(lasR::write_vpc(vpc_file, absolute_path = TRUE), on = las_files) #> [1] "C:\\Users\\JWIESE~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpghBJtg\\file16ffcbda271a.vpc" vpc_obj <- yyjsonr::read_json_file(vpc_file) mixed <- c(folder, las_file)  paths <- list(folder, las_files, las_file, vpc_file, vpc_obj, mixed)  # get the Coordinate Reference System for all types of input lapply(paths, get_crs) #> [[1]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #>  #> [[2]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #>  #> [[3]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #>  #> [[4]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #>  #> [[5]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #>  #> [[6]] #>                            filename   crs #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 25832  # get the extent (bbox) from LASfiles get_extent(las_files) #>                            filename   xmin    ymin     xmax    ymax #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 547690 5724000 547999.7 5725000 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 547648 5725000 547998.1 5725991 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz 548000 5724000 548992.0 5724997 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz 548000 5725000 548995.4 5725992  # get names of files intersecting an extent las_files |>   filter_spatial(c(547900, 5724900, 548100, 5724900)) |>   get_names() #> [1] "3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz" "3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz"  # combine with temporal filter las_files |>   filter_temporal("2024-03") |>   filter_spatial(c(547900, 5724900, 548100, 5724900)) |>   get_names() #> [1] "3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz" "3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz"

what: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
title: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
text: check_names() verifies whether LAS/LAZ/COPC file names conform German AdV standard tiled LiDAR data. File names expected follow schema: prefix_utmzone_minx_miny_tilesize_region_year.laz. Example: 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_2024.laz. See ADV standard details.

title: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
code: check_names(   path,   prefix = "3dm",   zone = 32,   region = NULL,   year = NULL,   copc = FALSE,   full.names = FALSE )

title: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
text: path Character vector. Paths LAS/LAZ/COPC files directories containing files. prefix Character scalar. Naming prefix (default: "3dm"). zone Integer scalar. UTM zone (default: 32). region Optional character vector two-letter region codes. NULL, region automatically inferred file bounding boxes. year Optional acquisition year (YYYY) path CSV file. NULL, year derived LAS header GPStime metadata. copc Logical. Whether files expected COPC (.copc.laz). full.names Logical. TRUE, returns full file paths name_is name_should; otherwise, base file names.

title: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
text: data.frame one row per file columns: name_is Existing file name path name_should Expected file name according AdV standard correct Logical indicating whether existing name matches standard

title: Validate LAS file names according to the ADV standard — check_names
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") check_names(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
text: Check tiles valid (correct size aligned grid)

title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
code: check_tiling(path, tilesize = 1000, full.names = FALSE, tolerance = 1)

title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing LAS files. tilesize Numeric. Expected tile size units (default: 1000) full.names Logical. Whether return full file paths (default: FALSE) tolerance Numeric. Tolerance coordinate units snapping extents grid (default: 1, submeter inaccuaries ignored). > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped processing. Set 0 disable snapping.

title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
text: data.frame columns: filename Name file size_ok Logical indicating tile correct dimensions grid_ok Logical indicating tile aligned grid valid Logical indicating tile correct size aligned

title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
text: tolerance > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped grid line validation. helps handle minor floating point inaccuracies small coordinate errors preserving coordinates genuinely misaligned.

title: Check if tiles are valid (correct size and aligned to grid) — check_tiling
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") check_tiling(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
text: Identifies tiles multiple acquisitions returns first (earliest) acquisition tile filtered VPC.

title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
code: filter_first(   path,   entire_tiles = TRUE,   tolerance = 1,   multitemporal_only = FALSE,   out_file = NULL )

title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
text: path Character vector input paths, VPC file path, VPC object already loaded R. Can mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files .vpc files. entire_tiles Logical. TRUE (default), considers tiles entire tile area multi-temporal coverage. FALSE, includes tiles partial multi-temporal coverage. tolerance Numeric. Tolerance coordinate units snapping extents grid (default: 1, submeter inaccuracies ignored). > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped processing. Set 0 disable snapping. multitemporal_only Logical. TRUE, returns tiles multiple acquisitions. FALSE (default), includes tiles. out_file Optional. Path filtered VPC saved. NULL (default), returns VPC R object. provided, saves file returns file path. Must .vpc extension must already exist. File created filtering returns results.

title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
text: out_file NULL, returns VPC object (list) containing first acquisition tile. out_file provided results exist, returns path saved .vpc file. Returns NULL invisibly features match filter.

title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
text: function performs following steps: Resolves input paths VPC object Checks multi-temporal coverage using filter_multitemporal Groups tiles location selects earliest acquisition Returns either VPC object writes filtered VPC file

title: Filter to first acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_first
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") vpc <- filter_first(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
text: Identifies tiles multiple acquisitions returns latest (newest) acquisition tile filtered VPC.

title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
code: filter_latest(   path,   entire_tiles = TRUE,   tolerance = 1,   multitemporal_only = FALSE,   out_file = NULL )

title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
text: path Character vector input paths, VPC file path, VPC object already loaded R. Can mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files .vpc files. entire_tiles Logical. TRUE (default), considers tiles entire tile area multi-temporal coverage. FALSE, includes tiles partial multi-temporal coverage. tolerance Numeric. Tolerance coordinate units snapping extents grid (default: 1, submeter inaccuracies ignored). > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped processing. Set 0 disable snapping. multitemporal_only Logical. TRUE, returns tiles multiple acquisitions. FALSE (default), includes tiles. out_file Optional. Path filtered VPC saved. NULL (default), returns VPC R object. provided, saves file returns file path. Must .vpc extension must already exist. File created filtering returns results.

title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
text: out_file NULL, returns VPC object (list) containing latest acquisition tile. out_file provided results exist, returns path saved .vpc file. Returns NULL invisibly features match filter.

title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
text: function performs following steps: Resolves input paths VPC object Checks multi-temporal coverage using filter_multitemporal Groups tiles location selects latest acquisition Returns either VPC object writes filtered VPC file

title: Filter to latest acquisition from multi-temporal tiles — filter_latest
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") vpc <- filter_latest(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
text: Identifies filters tiles observed multiple times (multi-temporal coverage), returning VPC tiles.

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
code: filter_multitemporal(path, entire_tiles = TRUE, tolerance = 1)

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
text: path Character vector input paths, VPC file path, VPC object already loaded R. Can mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files .vpc files. entire_tiles Logical. TRUE, considers tiles exactly 1000x1000 m aligned 1000m grid (default: TRUE) tolerance Numeric. Tolerance coordinate units snapping extents grid (default: 1, submeter inaccuracies ignored). > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped processing. Set 0 disable snapping.

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
text: VPC object (list) containing tiles multiple temporal observations. Returns NULL invisibly multi-temporal tiles found.

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
text: function identifies tiles observed multiple times (multi-temporal coverage). reads extent date information VPC (Virtual Point Cloud) file, optionally snaps coordinates regular grid, groups observations spatial extent. entire_tiles = TRUE, tiles exactly 1000x1000 m aligned 1000 m grid included analysis. tolerance > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped handle minor floating point inaccuracies. Important: returned VPC contains observations multi-temporal tiles, meaning multiple files may reference spatial tile. typically suitable direct processing workflows lasR, data processed together. E.g. creating Canopy Height Model based multi-temporal VPCs result single CHM raster based lidar data acquisitions instead separate CHM raster acquisition time. Usually want use filter_first filter_latest instead. intermediate filtering step might useful need : Identify tiles multi-temporal data selecting time period Explicitly want work combined multi-temporal data

title: Filter to multi-temporal tiles — filter_multitemporal
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar")  # Identify multi-temporal tiles vpc_multi <- filter_multitemporal(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’   # Or chain filters for specific workflows: vpc <- f |>   filter_multitemporal() |>   filter_temporal("2024") |>   filter_latest() #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
title: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
text: Filter point cloud files spatial extent

title: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
code: filter_spatial(path, extent, crs = NULL, out_file = NULL)

title: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
text: path Character vector input paths, VPC file path, VPC object already loaded R. Can mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files .vpc files. extent Spatial extent filter . Can : Numeric vector length 2 (point: x, y) 4 (bbox: xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) sf/sfc object (point, multipoint, polygon, bbox) crs Character numeric. Coordinate reference system extent. NULL (default) extent numeric, assumes extent CRS VPC features. Required sf objects without CRS. Can EPSG code (e.g., 4326, 25832) WKT2 string. out_file Optional. Path filtered VPC saved. NULL (default), returns VPC R object. provided, saves file returns file path. Must .vpc extension must already exist. File created filtering returns results.

title: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
text: out_file NULL, returns VPC object (list) containing features intersect extent. out_file provided results exist, returns path saved .vpc file. Returns NULL invisibly features match filter.

title: Filter point cloud files by spatial extent — filter_spatial
code: # Example using the package's extdata folder f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") filter_spatial(f, c(547700, 5724010)) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
title: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
text: Filter point cloud files temporal extent

title: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
code: filter_temporal(path, start, end = NULL, out_file = NULL)

title: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
text: path Character vector input paths, VPC file path, VPC object already loaded R. Can mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files .vpc files. start POSIXct, Date, character. Start temporal range (inclusive). Character strings parsed ISO 8601 datetime (e.g., "2024-03-27" "2024-03-27T10:30:00Z"). Can also year ("2024"), year-month ("2024-03"), full date ("2024-03-27"). end POSIXct, Date, character. End temporal range (inclusive). NULL (default), end automatically determined based granularity start: Year ("2024"): end year Year-month ("2024-03"): end month Full date ("2024-03-27"): end day (23:59:59) Full datetime: start (exact match) out_file Optional. Path filtered VPC saved. NULL (default), returns VPC R object. provided, saves file returns file path. Must .vpc extension must already exist. File created filtering returns results.

title: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
text: out_file NULL, returns VPC object (list) containing features within temporal range. out_file provided results exist, returns path saved .vpc file. Returns NULL invisibly features match filter.

title: Filter point cloud files by temporal extent — filter_temporal
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Filter by single day (all features from that day) las_files |> filter_temporal("2024-03-27")  # Filter by month (all features from March 2024) las_files |> filter_temporal("2024-03")  # Filter by year (all features from 2024) las_files |> filter_temporal("2024")  # Filter by explicit date range las_files |> filter_temporal("2024-03-01", "2024-03-31")  # Filter by datetime range las_files |> filter_temporal("2024-03-27T00:00:00Z", "2024-03-27T12:00:00Z")  # Using Date objects las_files |> filter_temporal(as.Date("2024-03-27"))  # Save to file las_files |> filter_temporal("2024-03", out_file = "march.vpc") } # }

what: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
text: get_crs() efficiently extracts returns coordinate reference system (EPSG code) LAS files.

title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
code: get_crs(path, full.names = FALSE)

title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing LAS files. full.names Logical. TRUE, returned filenames full paths; FALSE (default), base filenames used.

title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
text: data.frame two columns: filename filename full path LAS file. crs EPSG code file's coordinate reference system.

title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
text: function efficiently reads Coordinate Reference System LAS files VPC. suitable quickly inspecting CRS multiple LAS/LAZ/COPC files.

title: Get the Coordinate Reference System (CRS) of LAS files — get_crs
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_crs(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
title: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
text: function copies data one folder another folder, ensuring certain data formating folder structure. CRS set, points sorted, files compressed, files renamed according ADV standard, files ordered folders acquisition date campaign, VPC created files spatially indexed COPC.

title: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
code: get_data(   origin,   destination,   campaign,   origin_recurse = FALSE,   prefix = "3dm",   zone = 32,   region = NULL,   year = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
text: origin path. path directory contains las/laz files destination path. directory processed files copied subfolders (year/campaign) created campaign character. Name project campaign data acquisition. origin_recurse boolean. files subfolder included? prefix 3 letter character. Naming prefix (defaults "3dm") zone 2 digits integer. UTM zone (defaults 32) region 2 letter character. (optional) federal state abbreviation. fetched automatically defined (default). year YYYY. (optional) acquisition year append filename. provided (default) year extracted files. acquisition date points contain datetime GPStime format, otherwise get year file header, processing date definition.

title: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
text: structured copy input lidar data

title: Get data in a standardized format and structure — get_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_data(f, tempdir(), "landesbefliegung") } # }

what: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
text: get_date() derives acquisition date LAS/LAZ/COPC files.

title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
code: get_date(   path,   full.names = FALSE,   from_csv = NULL,   return_referenceyear = FALSE )

title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing files. full.names Logical. TRUE, filenames output full paths; FALSE (default), base filenames returned. from_csv Character NULL. provided, path CSV file containing acquisition dates tiles without GPS time. CSV must columns minx, miny (tile lower-left coordinates km) date (YYYY-MM-DD). NULL (default), dates non-GPS tiles set NA. return_referenceyear Logical. TRUE, returns reference year instead acquisition date (e.g., reference year 2015 data acquired December 2014). Default FALSE.

title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
text: data.frame columns: filename Filename LAS file. date Acquisition date (POSIXct GPS-encoded files, Date others) reference year return_referenceyear = TRUE. Character. One data (files valid GPStime data), csv (files corresponding date CSV file) header (files)

title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
text: function attempts determine acquisition date LASfiles embedded GPStime point cloud possible (LAS 1.3+). possible date extracted  processing date encoded LASheader. valid CSV-file provided latest acquisition date prior processing date returned files without GPStime instead processing date. LAS 1.3+ files GPS time encoding, function extracts date first point. older files without GPS time, from_csv provided, function attempt assign closest acquisition date prior processing date CSV file, based tile coordinates. neither GPStime CSV data available, date LASheader (processing date). return_referenceyear = TRUE shifts December acquisitions following year standardize reference years.

title: Get acquisition date from LAS files — get_date
code: # Example using the package's extdata folder f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_date(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’  # Using an external CSV for reference dates csv_path <- system.file("extdata", "acquisition_dates_lgln.csv", package = "managelidar") get_date(f, from_csv = csv_path) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
text: get_density() calculates approximate average point pulse density LAS files.

title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
code: get_density(path, full.names = FALSE)

title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing files. full.names Logical. TRUE, filenames output full paths; otherwise base filenames (default).

title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
text: data.frame columns: filename File name path. npoints Total number points file. npulses Number first-return pulses. area Area bounding box (units CRS^2). pointdensity Approximate points per unit area. pulsedensity Approximate first-return pulses per unit area.

title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density
text: LAS file headers read. Densities calculated based bounding box number points / first-return pulses. account missing data within bounding box, density approximate faster compute reading full point cloud.

title: Get approximate point and pulse density of LAS files — get_density

what: Get the spatial extent of LAS files — get_extent

title: Get the spatial extent of LAS files — get_extent
code: get_extent(path, as_sf = FALSE, full.names = FALSE)

title: Get the spatial extent of LAS files — get_extent
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing files. as_sf Logical. TRUE, returns sf object geometry. full.names Logical. TRUE, filenames output full paths; otherwise base filenames (default).

title: Get the spatial extent of LAS files — get_extent
text: data.frame sf object columns: filename Filename LAS file. xmin Minimum X coordinate. xmax Maximum X coordinate. ymin Minimum Y coordinate. ymax Maximum Y coordinate. geometry (optional) Polygon geometry as_sf = TRUE.

title: Get the spatial extent of LAS files — get_extent
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_extent(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
text: get_gpkg() converts metadata Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) collection LAS/LAZ/COPC files Geopackage. VPCs can read vizualized QGIS, however individual tiles (features) can queried . convert Geopackage, can easily explored GIS. LAS tile becomes feature spatial extent metadata.

title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
code: get_gpkg(   path,   out_file = tempfile(fileext = ".gpkg"),   overwrite = FALSE,   crs = 25832,   metrics = NULL )

title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) file. out_file Path output Geopackage (.gpkg) file (default: tempfile). overwrite Logical. TRUE, overwrite output file exists (default: FALSE). crs Integer. Optional EPSG code reproject VPC (default: 25832).

title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
text: Invisibly returns sf object representing tiles written Geopackage.

title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
text: Summary metrics (optional) can included setting metrics = TRUE default metrics providing character vector custom metrics. Computing metrics requires reading actual point data, und thus can much slower. See get_summary() details.

title: Create a Geopackage containing metadata of LAS files — get_gpkg
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_gpkg(f, tempfile(fileext = ".gpkg")) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

title: Retrieve LAS file headers (metadata) — get_header

title: Retrieve LAS file headers (metadata) — get_header
text: named list LASheader S4 objects, one per file. Use names() see file names paths.

title: Retrieve LAS file headers (metadata) — get_header

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
text: get_intersection() identifies LAS/LAZ/COPC files whose spatial extents intersect spatially equal two inputs.

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
code: get_intersection(   path1,   path2,   mode = "intersects",   as_sf = FALSE,   full.names = FALSE )

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
text: path1 Character. Path(s) LAS/LAZ/COPC files, directory, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc). path2 Character. Path(s) LAS/LAZ/COPC files, directory, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc). mode Character. Spatial predicate use: "intersects" (default) "equals". as_sf Logical. TRUE, return results sf objects; otherwise drop geometries (default). full.names Logical. TRUE, filenames returned full paths; otherwise base filenames (default).

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
text: named list two elements (path1, path2), containing data.frame sf object column filename intersecting equal file extents.

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
text: function simply checks intersection two inputs. is_multitemporal contrast newer addition works single input (can vector multiple files/folders), cases filter_first / filter_latest might best choice.

title: Get intersecting LAS files — get_intersection
code: folder <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") file <- list.files(folder, full.names = TRUE)[1] get_intersection(folder, file) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Get the LAS version of point cloud files — get_lasversion

title: Get the LAS version of point cloud files — get_lasversion
code: get_lasversion(path, full.names = FALSE)

title: Get the LAS version of point cloud files — get_lasversion
text: path Character. Path(s) LAS/LAZ/COPC files, directory containing files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing files. full.names Logical. TRUE, filenames output full paths; otherwise base filenames (default).

title: Get the LAS version of point cloud files — get_lasversion
text: data.frame columns: filename Filename LAS file. lasversion LAS version Major.Minor format.

title: Get the LAS version of point cloud files — get_lasversion
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") get_lasversion(f) #>                            filename lasversion #> 1 3dm_32_547_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz        1.4 #> 2 3dm_32_547_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz        1.4 #> 3 3dm_32_548_5724_1_ni_20240327.laz        1.4 #> 4 3dm_32_548_5725_1_ni_20240327.laz        1.4

title: Get LAS file names — get_names
text: get_names() returns filenames LAS-related point cloud files (.las, .laz, .copc) found given input.

title: Get LAS file names — get_names
code: get_names(path, full.names = FALSE)

title: Get LAS file names — get_names
text: path Character. Path(s) LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc). full.names Logical. TRUE, return full file paths; otherwise return base filenames (default).

title: Get LAS file names — get_names
text: character vector filenames file paths.

title: Get LAS file names — get_names
text: input may single file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing LAS/LAZ/COPC files. Internally, file paths resolved using resolve_las_paths().

title: Get LAS file names — get_names

what: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
text: get_penetration() computes approximate pulse penetration ratios LAS/LAZ/COPC files using information stored LAS file header. header data read; point data loaded.

title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
code: get_penetration(path, full.names = FALSE)

title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
text: path Character vector specifying one paths : LAS/LAZ/COPC files Directories containing LAS/LAZ/COPC files (non-recursive) Virtual Point Cloud files (.vpc) referencing LAS files full.names Logical. TRUE, return full file paths filename column. FALSE (default), base file names returned.

title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
text: data.frame one row per input file following columns: filename File name full path LAS file single Proportion pulses exactly one return two Proportion pulses exactly two returns three Proportion pulses exactly three returns four Proportion pulses exactly four returns five Proportion pulses exactly five returns six Proportion pulses exactly six returns multiple Proportion pulses two returns

title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration
text: function estimates proportion pulses resulted exactly one return, two returns, three returns, six returns, well proportion pulses multiple returns (two ). Pulse penetration ratios derived “Number points return” field LAS header. header information used, results approximate. small files spatially clipped tiles, pulses may split tile boundaries, can lead biased penetration ratios. Consequently, values interpreted indicative rather exact.

title: Compute pulse penetration ratios from LAS headers — get_penetration

what: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
title: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
text: get_summary() calculates standard summary metrics LAS files, including:

title: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
code: get_summary(   path,   out_dir = NULL,   full.names = FALSE,   samplebased = FALSE,   zwbin = 10,   iwbin = 100,   metrics = c("t_min", "t_median", "t_max", "i_min", "i_mean", "i_median", "i_max",     "i_p5", "i_p95", "i_sd", "z_min", "z_median", "z_max") )

title: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
text: path Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) file. out_dir Optional directory save JSON summaries. set, function returns named list instead. full.names Logical. TRUE, returned list named full paths; otherwise, basenames used. samplebased Logical. TRUE, reads spatial subsample file (faster large files). zwbin Numeric. Bin width (meters) elevation histogram (z_histogram). Set 0 skip z_histogram. iwbin Numeric. Bin width (intensity units) intensity histogram (i_histogram). Set 0 skip i_histogram. metrics Character vector metrics compute. Defaults : c("t_min", "t_median", "t_max", "i_min", "i_mean", "i_median", "i_max", "i_p5", "i_p95", "i_sd", "z_min", "z_median", "z_max").

title: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
text: out_dir set, returns named list, one element per LAS file. element list containing: npoints Total number points nsingle Number single-return points nwithheld Number withheld points nsynthetic Number synthetic points npoints_per_return Named vector counts per return number npoints_per_class Named vector counts per classification code z_histogram Elevation histogram (zwbin > 0) i_histogram Intensity histogram (iwbin > 0) epsg EPSG code LAS file CRS metrics List calculated summary metrics, e.g., min, median, max time, intensity, elevation out_dir set, function returns NULL invisibly writing JSON files.

title: Compute summary metrics for individual LAS files and optionally save as JSON — get_summary
text: Temporal metrics (t_min, t_median, t_max) Intensity metrics (i_min, i_mean, i_median, i_max, i_p5, i_p95, i_sd) Elevation metrics (z_min, z_median, z_max) Histograms (i_histogram, z_histogram) iwbin zwbin greater 0 Point counts classifications (npoints, nsingle, nwithheld, nsynthetic, npoints_per_return, npoints_per_class) Coordinate system (epsg) Results can optionally saved JSON files per LAS file. comparison lasR::summarise function returns individual summaries per file instead aggregated summary among files. out_dir provided, JSON file created LAS file, name .json extension. Existing JSON files skipped automatically. out_dir provided, function returns named list element corresponds LAS file. Setting iwbin = 0 zwbin = 0 disables calculation intensity elevation histograms, can save time memory large datasets. Parallel processing used automatically large numbers files map_las().

what: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
text: is_classified() determines whether LAS point cloud files contain point classifications class 0 (unclassified).

title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
code: is_classified(path, full.names = FALSE, add_classes = FALSE)

title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc). full.names Logical. TRUE, return full file paths; otherwise return base filenames (default). add_classes Logical. TRUE, include list-column detected classification codes present sampled points.

title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
text: data.frame columns: file Filename LAS file. classified Logical indicating whether classified points (class > 0) present. classes (Optional) List column detected class codes.

title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
text: Unlike header-based functions, function reads actual point data. reduce /O overhead, subset points sampled: LAS/LAZ files, points sampled small circular region around spatial center file. COPC files, first hierarchy level read. result, classification status inferred sampled points may reflect full contents file.

title: Check whether LAS files are classified — is_classified
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") is_classified(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’ is_classified(f, add_classes = TRUE) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

what: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
text: Analyzes tiles multi-temporal coverage. Returns data frame tile information including whether tile multiple observations many.

title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
code: is_multitemporal(   path,   entire_tiles = TRUE,   tolerance = 1,   full.names = FALSE,   multitemporal_only = FALSE )

title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file, directory containing LAS files, Virtual Point Cloud (.vpc) referencing LAS files. entire_tiles Logical. TRUE, considers tiles exactly 1000x1000 m aligned 1000m grid (default: TRUE) tolerance Numeric. Tolerance coordinate units snapping extents grid (default: 1, submeter inaccuaries ignored). > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped processing. Set 0 disable snapping. full.names Logical. Whether return full file paths (default: FALSE) multitemporal_only Logical. TRUE, returns tiles multiple observations (default: FALSE)

title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
text: data.frame columns: filename Name path file tile Tile identifier (xmin_ymin km) date Date observation multitemporal Logical indicating tile multiple observations observations Number observations tile

title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
text: function identifies tiles observed multiple times (multi-temporal coverage). reads extent date information VPC (Virtual Point Cloud) file, optionally snaps coordinates regular grid, groups observations spatial extent. entire_tiles = TRUE, tiles 1000x1000 m aligned 1000 m grid included analysis. tolerance > 0, coordinates within distance grid line snapped handle minor inaccuracies.

title: Check for multi-temporal coverage in LAS/LAZ files — is_multitemporal
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") is_multitemporal(f) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘lasR’

code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") print_pulseinfo(f) #> Density (⌀): #> ---------------- #> Pulse Density : 0 pulses/m² #> Point Density : 0 points/m² #>  #> Pulse Penetration Rate (⌀): #> ---------------- #> Single Returns   : 64.5 % #> Multiple Returns : 35.5 % #>   Two Returns    : -8.3 % #>   Three Returns  : 10.8 % #>   Four Returns   : 23 % #>   Five Returns   : 9.7 % #>   Six Returns    : 0.3 %

title: Resolve LAS/LAZ/COPC input paths — resolve_las_paths
text: Resolves character vector file system paths VPC objects flat character vector LAS/LAZ/COPC file paths. Inputs may individual files, directories, .vpc files, VPC objects already loaded R. Unsupported paths formats silently ignored.

title: Resolve LAS/LAZ/COPC input paths — resolve_las_paths
code: resolve_las_paths(paths)

title: Resolve LAS/LAZ/COPC input paths — resolve_las_paths
text: paths Character vector file directory paths, list may contain VPC objects (lists type = "FeatureCollection").

title: Resolve LAS/LAZ/COPC input paths — resolve_las_paths
text: character vector resolved LAS/LAZ/COPC file paths. Returns empty character vector (invisibly) valid files found.

title: Resolve LAS/LAZ/COPC input paths — resolve_las_paths
text: function intended internal use. performs validation beyond basic existence checks never errors warns. Supported inputs: Individual .las, .laz, .copc files Directories (non-recursive search) .vpc files (assets extracted VPC JSON) VPC objects already loaded R (lists type = "FeatureCollection") Unsupported file formats, non-existent paths, empty directories, unreadable .vpc files silently skipped.

what: Resolve input paths to a single deduplicated VPC — resolve_vpc
title: Resolve input paths to a single deduplicated VPC — resolve_vpc
text: Takes mix LAS/LAZ/COPC files, .vpc files, VPC objects already loaded R, merges needed, deduplicates tiles (based storage location), returns VPC object file path.

title: Resolve input paths to a single deduplicated VPC — resolve_vpc
code: resolve_vpc(paths, out_file = NULL)

title: Resolve input paths to a single deduplicated VPC — resolve_vpc
text: paths Character vector input paths, list containing VPC objects. Can mix file paths (strings) VPC objects (lists type="FeatureCollection"). out_file Optional. Path VPC saved. NULL (default), returns VPC R object. provided, saves file returns file path.

title: Resolve input paths to a single deduplicated VPC — resolve_vpc
text: out_file NULL, returns list containing VPC structure. out_file provided, returns path saved .vpc file.

what: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
text: set_names() renames LAS/LAZ/COPC files match ADV naming standard.

title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
code: set_names(   path,   prefix = "3dm",   zone = 32,   region = NULL,   year = NULL,   copc = FALSE,   dry_run = FALSE )

title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
text: path Character. Path LAS/LAZ/COPC file directory containing LAS files. prefix Character. Naming prefix (default "3dm"). zone Integer. UTM zone (default 32). region Character. Federal state abbreviation (optional). Automatically determined NULL. year Integer character. Acquisition year append filenames (optional). NULL, year derived file. copc Logical. Whether files COPC (.copc.laz, default FALSE). dry_run Logical. TRUE, preview renaming without modifying files (default FALSE). verbose Logical. Print messages preview renaming (default FALSE).

title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
text: Invisibly returns data.frame columns showing original new filenames.

title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
text: Files expected follow schema: prefix_utmzone_minx_miny_tilesize_region_year.laz

title: Set LAS file names according to ADV standard — set_names
code: f <- system.file("extdata", package = "managelidar") set_names(copy, verbose = TRUE, dry_run = TRUE) #> Error in set_names(copy, verbose = TRUE, dry_run = TRUE): unused argument (verbose = TRUE)
